etymologies: modern Latin, named after Pierre Magnol (1638–1715), French botanist

definitions: a tree or shrub with large, typically creamy-pink, waxy flowers. Magnolias are widely grown as ornamental trees.

notes.text: Genus Magnolia, family Magnoliaceae: numerous species, including M. campbellii, native to the Himalayas and from which several varieties have been cultivated in North America

shortDefinitions: tree or shrub with large waxy flowers
